intro: Stegnosperma scandens, commonly known as the climbing stegnosperma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a woody vine native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four to five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds.
